moves.2... b6 3. bxc5 bxc5 4. Nc3 d6 5. Bc4 Nf: To take the control of the open file
moves.10. Bb5+ Ned7 11. O-O: Black has 5 pieces out against 8 for white
moves.12... Be7 13. Bxf6: trading to get an outpost knight on d5
moves.13... Bxf6 14. Nd5 O-O: White's plan is to trade the minor pieces in order to weaken black's pawn structure and attack the black king
moves.15. Bxd7: forc,g the queen to live the h4 d8 diagonal
moves.15... Qxd7 16. Nxf6+: To weaken black's pawn structure and get rid of the DSB which could be annoying because the white king is on g1, on an open diagonal
moves.17... Bg6 18. f4 h6: Making a retreating place for the bishop... but weakening the king
moves.23... Rfg8 24. Rf3: Reinforcement is needed to the attack
moves.24... Rg7: It protects the LSB but black is lost
moves.30... Rg8+ 31. Kf3: To take the control of f4 and g4
moves.31... d5: Blunder. There is a mate in 2. The only possible move was 31.f6
